pageContext.claim: “Under NAFTA, companies were given huge incentives to produce cars in foreign countries and ship them to America tax-free. No tax, no nothing. We lost our jobs, we closed our factories, and other countries built our cars. But we've changed that.”
pageContext.analysis: Motor vehicle output continued to grow in the United States since 1994, even recovering after the Great Recession, according to the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis.
